_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Sunkenland
author: engels74@marx.ps
description: Sunkenland is a Waterworld-themed survival game. Explore sunken cities, build your base, craft items, trade, and fight pirates as you struggle to survive in an aquatic post-apocalypse world plagued by hunger and violence.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# steamcmd Base Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
# Image to install with is 'ghcr.io/parkervcp/installers:debian'

##
#
# Variables
# STEAM_USER, STEAM_PASS, STEAM_AUTH - Steam user setup. If a user has 2fa enabled it will most likely fail due to timeout. Leave blank for anon install.
# WINDOWS_INSTALL - if it's a windows server you want to install set to 1
# SRCDS_APPID - steam app id found here - https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List
# SRCDS_BETAID - beta branch of a steam app. Leave blank to install normal branch
# SRCDS_BETAPASS - password for a beta branch should one be required during private or closed testing phases.. Leave blank for no password.
# INSTALL_FLAGS - Any additional SteamCMD  flags to pass during install.. Keep in mind that steamcmd auto update process in the docker image might overwrite or ignore these when it performs update on server boot.
# AUTO_UPDATE - Adding this variable to the egg allows disabling or enabling automated updates on boot. Boolean value. 0 to disable and 1 to enable.
#
 ##

## just in case someone removed the defaults.
if [[ "${STEAM_USER}" == "" ]] || [[ "${STEAM_PASS}" == "" ]]; then
    echo -e "steam user is not set.\n"
    echo -e "Using anonymous user.\n"
    STEAM_USER=anonymous
    STEAM_PASS=""
    STEAM_AUTH=""
else
    echo -e "user set to ${STEAM_USER}"
fi

## download and install steamcmd
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steamcmd
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamapps # Fix steamcmd disk write error when this folder is missing
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd

# SteamCMD fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
chown -R root:root /mnt
export HOME=/mnt/server

## install game using steamcmd
./steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login ${STEAM_USER} ${STEAM_PASS} ${STEAM_AUTH} $( [[ "${WINDOWS_INSTALL}" == "1" ]] && printf %s '+@sSteamCmdForcePlatformType windows' ) +app_update ${SRCDS_APPID} $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAID} ]] || printf %s "-beta ${SRCDS_BETAID}" ) $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAPASS} ]] || printf %s "-betapassword ${SRCDS_BETAPASS}" ) ${INSTALL_FLAGS} validate +quit ## other flags may be needed depending on install. looking at you cs 1.6

## set up 32 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk32
cp -v linux32/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk32/steamclient.so

## set up 64 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk64
cp -v linux64/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk64/steamclient.so

## Setup World folder
# Create a temporary directory
mkdir -p /tmp/world_files

# Clone the repository
git clone --depth 1 --filter=blob:none --sparse https://github.com/parkervcp/eggs /tmp/world_files/pterodactyl-eggs
cd /tmp/world_files/pterodactyl-eggs

# Initialize sparse-checkout
git sparse-checkout init --cone

# Adding "world-files" path to pull
git sparse-checkout set game_eggs/steamcmd_servers/sunkenland/world_files

# Pull only the specified folder
git pull origin master

# Move the contents the required location
mkdir -p "/mnt/server/.wine/drive_c/users/container/AppData/LocalLow/Vector3 Studio/Sunkenland"
mv /tmp/world_files/pterodactyl-eggs/game_eggs/steamcmd_servers/sunkenland/world_files/* "/mnt/server/.wine/drive_c/users/container/AppData/LocalLow/Vector3 Studio/Sunkenland"

## Rename the folder to include SERVER_NAME
# Define the original and new folder names
ORIGINAL_FOLDER="/mnt/server/.wine/drive_c/users/container/AppData/LocalLow/Vector3 Studio/Sunkenland/Worlds/Pterodactyl World~76c82b71-6e5b-43e1-96af-6d6024a0b756"
NEW_FOLDER="/mnt/server/.wine/drive_c/users/container/AppData/LocalLow/Vector3 Studio/Sunkenland/Worlds/${SERVER_NAME}~76c82b71-6e5b-43e1-96af-6d6024a0b756"

# Check if the original folder exists
if [ -d "$ORIGINAL_FOLDER" ]; then
    # Rename the folder
    mv "$ORIGINAL_FOLDER" "$NEW_FOLDER"
    echo "Server has been renamed from "Pterodactyl World" to "${SERVER_NAME}", with World GUID: 76c82b71-6e5b-43e1-96af-6d6024a0b756"
else
    echo "Original folder does not exist. Cannot rename."
fi

# Clean up the temporary directory
rm -rf /tmp/world_files

## install end
echo "-----------------------------------------"
echo "Installation completed..."
echo "-----------------------------------------"

variables.name: [REQUIRED] Steam App ID
variables.description: Steam App ID of Sunkenland Server

variables.name: [OPTIONAL] Steam Beta Branch
variables.description: If you want to use a specific branch

variables.name: [REQUIRED] World GUID
variables.description: The world GUID is the later part of the world save file, for example, in this save file 'YourWorldName~11223344-5566-7788-99AA-BBCCDDEEF F00', the part after '~' symbol is the guid, i.e. '11223344-5566-7788-99AA-BBCCDDEEFF00'. Specify which World to start the game, if the world save file with entered GUID cannot be found, the server will fail to start and shut down itself.

variables.name: Server Region
variables.description: Set the custom Server Region. Default is ASIA. Possible values: asia, cn, jp, eu, sa, kr, us, usw

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Set the Max Player Count. The minimum value is 3 and the maximum value is 15. Default is 3.

variables.name: [SYSTEM] Windows Install Flag
variables.description: Required for windows game server installs
